meaningMnemonic:
The <kanji>misfortune</kanji> is just getting <kanji>jammed in</kanji> there. So much misfortune leads to very <vocabulary>troublesome</vocabulary> <vocabulary>trouble</vocabulary>.

厄介 describes something or someone that is troublesome, or the trouble itself. It's very similar to 面倒, but 厄介 is often used for more challenging or complicated situations.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own. The やく gets changed to やっ.
